nodes.bodyText: Lets send the datatable bytes as it is for now. We can avoid the conversion and also standardize on the datatable api

nodes.bodyText:
We do have an existing class named DataTableHandler -- the Netty inbound handler on the broker side that receives the DataTable from server.
Although the GRPC handler is in a different package, you may want to consider naming differently (probably have grpc prefix or suffix).
Secondly, from the interface it looks like this is slightly different from our existing DataTableHandler. It looks like, this does both 1 (outbound) submission of request to server and 2. (inbound) receiving the response which is DataTable. Is that correct?
It would be nice to add detailed Javadoc highlighting the semantics of this handler

nodes.bodyText: We should not skip the header check for proto files
Why do we need this plugin?
This is plugin is used to detect the os and include the protoc for that os: https://grpc.io/docs/languages/java/generated-code/
